title: ðŸ”´ Pahalgam Terror Attack: Civilians Targeted
description: In a shocking attack in Pahalgam, Jammu & Kashmir, 26 tourists were gunned down by militants who specifically targeted Hindu civilians. Witnesses reported that attackers asked names before opening fire, selectively killing non-Muslim men. The militant group The Resistant Front (TRF) claimed responsibility. India has severed diplomatic ties with Pakistan, shutting down cross-border travel and expelling Pakistani diplomats. Public outrage has surged, with demands for strong military retaliation against terror groups.

title: ðŸ”´ India Scraps Indus Water Treaty with Pakistan
description: India has suspended the Indus Water Treaty, halting water flow into Pakistan. Pakistan calls it an 'act of war,' while experts suggest complete blockage will take time due to infrastructure constraints. The treaty has been in place since 1960, governing water distribution between the two nations. Diplomatic tensions escalate as Pakistan threatens retaliatory actions.

title: ðŸ”´ Border Clashes Intensify: India-Pakistan Troops on High Alert
description: Cross-border firing escalates as both nations prepare for potential conflict. The Indian Air Force has launched Exercise 'Aakraman,' demonstrating its readiness for any hostile actions. Pakistan has shut down its airspace for Indian flights. The United Nations calls for restraint, warning of catastrophic consequences if tensions spiral further.

title: ðŸ”´ UPSC Results Declared: India's Top Rankers Announced
description: UPSC Civil Services Exam results are out! Shakti Dubey from Prayagraj secures All India Rank 1, followed by Harshita Goyal and Dongre Archit. The exam had over 10 lakh applicants competing for just 1,000 prestigious spots. Aspirants celebrate their achievements, while discussions on Indiaâ€™s highly competitive job market gain traction.

title: ðŸ”´ Job Crisis Deepens: 25 Lakh Apply for Peon Jobs
description: Rajasthan sees an unprecedented 25 lakh applications for 500 peon jobs, including MBA and PhD holders. The event highlights India's severe unemployment crisis. Government jobs remain a priority due to job security, pensions, and stability, pushing highly educated individuals to apply for low-paying positions.

title: ðŸ”´ Fake Food Crisis: 83% Market Samples Adulterated
description: A food safety study finds 83% of samplesâ€”including paneer, milk, and spicesâ€”failing quality tests due to severe adulteration. Investigators reveal harmful chemicals and synthetic ingredients in everyday food items. Consumers are advised to be cautious when purchasing dairy and packaged products.

title: ðŸ”´ Road Rage Incidents Surge Across India
description: Violent confrontations between motorists are on the rise across major Indian cities. Experts blame traffic congestion, stress, and reckless driving for the increasing cases of aggressive behavior. Recent viral incidents in Bengaluru and Gurugram highlight the severity of road rage as law enforcement struggles to contain violent clashes.
